sense.name: a conscious state of extreme agony
sense.examples: The physical torture a victim experienced burning at the stake is unimaginable. It was torture for the writer to realize the studio had simply stolen his screenplay. The 8-hour bus ride with no air-conditioning was torture for many of the passengers. It was torture for John to see his ex-girlfriend dating his worst enemy.

sense.name: the act of inflicting extreme pain on someone
sense.examples: The law banned torture for prisoners of war. The museum displayed many horrific instruments of torture from the 13th century. The agents were trained in techniques of psychological torture.

sense.name: a quality of distortion or over-refinement
sense.examples: The torture of the writer's convoluted prose is difficult to stay focused on. The torture of the tiny strands of intertwining and repeating colors gives the painting a busy appearace.
